source.name: Session Start Pattern
source.instructions: **Which of the following statements about the `pattern_session_start` flow are true? Select all that apply.**

answers.answer: It requires the user to send a greeting message first
It triggers automatically when a new conversation begins
The flow name can be customized to anything you prefer
It must include the intent `session_start` in its NLU trigger
It allows the bot to initiate the conversation

source.learningObjectives: SWBAT identify the key characteristics of the session start pattern in Rasa
source.guidance:
The correct answers are:

- It triggers automatically when a new conversation begins: This is the core purpose of the session start pattern.
- It must include the intent `session_start` in its NLU trigger: This specific intent is required for the pattern to work.
- It allows the bot to initiate the conversation: This is the key benefit - the bot can greet users without them needing to speak first.

The incorrect options are:
- It requires the user to send a greeting message first: The pattern_session_start flow is specifically designed to work without any user input.
- The flow name can be customized to anything you prefer: The name must be exactly `pattern_session_start` for Rasa to recognize it as the session start pattern.
